page.title: 17RECREATION
page.content: Recreation in the study area covers a wide range of activities ranging from the Albrighton Hunt at one end to the gardening facilities available for the individual at David Austen Roses. Along the course of the Worfe coarse fishing is permitted as well as in the pools of Hatton Grange .But here it is only open to estate workers,their families and guests at the house.Trout fishing also takes place along the Worfe but is on the decline with the lowering water table.Game shooting is done on a number of the estateswith the main centre being Hatton Grange. Fox hunting is followed by members of the Albighton Hunt whilst Albrighton Cricket Club has its ground in Bowling Green Lane which once had a bowling green in it.Many of the facilities of R.A.F. Cosford are used by local clubs and schools(see section on Sports).
